meanings.definition: A person or thing that impedes or obstructs progress.
meanings.sent1: The traffic cones were the impeders on the road, causing a delay in our journey.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree branches acted as impeders, blocking the path to the river.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became an impeder by hiding nuts in the middle of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: Fear can be an invisible impeder, holding us back from reaching our full potential.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead served as a foreboding impeder to our picnic plans.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various artifacts, including ancient impeders used by warriors.
meanings.sent2: In the forest, we stumbled upon a group of impeders, standing guard around a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: The collection of colorful impeders in the garden seemed to have a secret meeting every night.
meanings.sent4: The impeders in the old castle whispered stories of past battles to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling unique impeders from different cultures.

meanings.definition: Present tense form of the verb 'impede'.
meanings.sent1: The thick fog impeders our view of the mountains, making it difficult to navigate.
meanings.sent2: Please do not let your fears impede your progress towards your goals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten loves to playfully impede the dog's attempts to fetch the ball.
meanings.sent4: During rush hour, heavy traffic can impede the flow of vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds threatened to impede our journey across the open sea.
